definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Invest in a dairy farm and you'll have lots of liquid assets.
sentences.chinese: 投資牛奶場，你會有很多流動資產。

sentences.english: And people who lives in villages that is 70% of india's population does not a job or movable assests.
sentences.chinese: 佔印度人口70%的農村人口沒有工作或者流動資產。

sentences.english: Accounts Receivable are often classified as current assets.
sentences.chinese: 應收帳款通常歸入流動資產。

sentences.english: Current assets that cannot be classified under the above current asset headings.
sentences.chinese: 指不能歸屬於前述各款之流動資產。

sentences.english: Yes. but they can't just buy illiquid assets with them.
sentences.chinese: 但是不能用來買非流動資產。

sentences.english: Prepaid expenses are listed last among the current assets.
sentences.chinese: 預提費用被列示在流動資產的最後一項。

sentences.english: Then look at your Non-Current Assets at the start of the year and the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 然後看一下期初期末的非流動資產。

sentences.english: At the same time, these companies hold a large number of non-liquid assets.
sentences.chinese: 同時，這些公司持有大量的非流動資產。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)

pinyin: guo2 min2 sheng1 chan3 zong3 zhi2
